events.description: A phone call between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping described as excellent.
Upcoming seasonal holiday in China affecting corporate currency conversions.
The People's Bank of China set the daily reference rate for the yuan.
Upcoming release of inflation data to assess China's economic health.

facts.fact_text: The offshore yuan held around 6.93 per dollar on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: The offshore yuan held around 6.93 per dollar on Friday, heading for its strongest weekly gain since May 2023

facts.fact_text: The PBOC set the daily midpoint at 6.9590 per dollar.

evidences.evidence_text: PBOC, which set the daily midpoint at 6.9590 per dollar, weaker than a Reuters estimate

facts.fact_text: Companies increase dollar-to-yuan conversions ahead of the Lunar New Year.

evidences.evidence_text: Ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday, companies typically increase dollar-to-yuan conversions to meet payroll and bonus obligations.

claims.claim_text: Yuan gains may slow due to US dollar strength and thinner trading.

evidences.evidence_text: yuan gains may slow amid near-term US dollar strength and thinner trading as the holiday approaches.

claims.claim_text: There are expectations of a possible visit to China by Trump in April.

evidences.evidence_text: expectations of a possible visit to China in April and emphasis on his personal rapport with Xi.

evidence.evidence_text: Market sentiment was further boosted after US President Donald Trump described an “excellent” phone call with Chinese President Xi Jinping
Ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday, companies typically increase dollar-to-yuan conversions to meet payroll and bonus obligations.
Markets now await next week’s inflation data for China’s economic health and the outlook for monetary policy.
